physical_examinations.relevant_findings: The patient exhibited painful erythema and skin pustules over the left-sided periorbital and glabellar areas. Reduced visual acuity, an afferent pupillary defect, and ophthalmoplegia were noted upon examination of the left eye.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Visual acuity impairment and ophthalmoplegia persisted over the following 2 months after initial surgical intervention.
